Subject: positioning of user rights (viewer) on domain.
Description: Managing a new domain requires assigning roles to users individually. Is there a more efficient method to assign roles to multiple users across one or more domains simultaneously?
DevOps_Steps_to_Reproduce__c:
Take over the management of a new Active Directory domain.
Identify the users who need to be assigned specific roles within the domain.
Manually assign roles to each user one by one within the domain management interface.
Repeat the manual assignment process for each user across one or more domains.
What_We_Know__c:
//Recommended solution: Use claims-based authentication.
Create a group (either in Active Directory for Windows Authentication or in the identity provider for SAML/OpenID Connect).
Add users to the group and grant them access through the console.
//API Usage:
If using the API, users need to be created first.
Retrieve all domains the users need access to.
Grant authorization for those domains via the API (though this approach may be inefficient).
Ensure permissions are set on the entity level and assign domains to the entity if not already done.
Solution_Comment__c:
Recommended Solution: Use claims-based authentication.

Create a group in Active Directory (for Windows Authentication) or in the identity provider (for SAML/OpenID Connect).
Add users to the group and grant access through the console.
API Usage:

Create users via the API.
Retrieve all domains users need access to.
Grant authorization for those domains using the API (this method may be less efficient).
Ensure permissions are configured at the entity level and assign domains to the entity if applicable.
